Key Arguments: The bill poses a threat to freedom of speech and expression by allowing the government to suppress opinions it disagrees with.
Previous instances of government intervention in social media have led to the removal of valid opinions and content.
Exempting government and mainstream media from the bill allows them to spread misinformation without accountability.
The bill contradicts the government's promise to strengthen democracy and transparency.
Notable Quotes: This Bill represents a massive threat to freedom of speech and freedom of expression.
The Government had made an election promise to strengthen our democracy. Instead, it has continued the unjust persecution of whistleblowers.
